content.description: Stand start with left foot on left-rising ramp, left hand underclinging the corner crack, right hand on arete. Stand up and walk up ramp. Work up right end of slab using arete and jugs. Once in the "crater" reach left to apex of the lip for top-out.
content.location: At rightmost arete of side facing trailhead, keeping feet entirely on slab side.

content.description: Sit start at good crimp on the left end of the slab just around the arete. Reach left to large ledge on arete. Match hands on the ledge and swing onto the overhanging face. Move left into positive crimps, then work up blocky features to top.
content.protection: 2-3 pads (at least one for each side of arete)
content.location: Climbs right-most arete on side facing downhill, but starts just around the corner on the slab side facing the trailhead.

content.description: Considerably harder if short. Sit start at huge jug, smearing left foot and reaching right foot high onto left-rising rail. Make a powerful throw from the sit to reach half-way up the arete. Move easily up arete and reach right foot out right to large shelf. Move just right of the apex of the lip and reach right foot high onto top to mantle.
content.location: Left arete on side facing downhill.

content.description: Just a good old-fashioned dyno! Sit start as for Houston, We Have A Problem and launch to the apex. Sticking the swing is easier if you land one hand on each side of the apex.
content.location: Left arete on side facing downhill.

content.description: A super featured boulder with climbing on three sides and an easy downclimb on the fourth plus near-perfect landings all around.
